Description: Two mosaic slices joined: forming a head of Bes, frontal, of traditional type. The field is black, the flesh red, the beard and topknot are blue and yellow, while the nose and eyes are outlined in black with white and pale-blue details. The mouth is white and black. The head is outlined in yellow. The right edge retains the original border made of a single opaque yellow rod. All three pieces have been glued together in the present century. The two slices have probably been re-polished.
Bibliographic references: Tait 1991 / Five Thousand Years of Glass (pl.59)
